universal.name: Name
universal.distancesTutorialText: Distance is in feet. Leave a field blank to use this Pokémon's default for that type, or use 0 disable that type.
universal.pokemonThatEvolveUsingThisItem: Pokemon that evolve using this item
universal.firstCheckboxIsForProficiencySecondCheck: First checkbox is for proficiency. Second checkbox is for expertise.
universal.fileIsTooLargeMustBeLessThan: File is too large. Must be less than
universal.generalNotesPlaceholder: Use this for any general notes not covered by the above fields...
universal.oneOrMoreFieldsAboveHaveAnIssue: One or more fields above have an issue.

fakemon.title: Fakémon
fakemon.addFakemonHintText: Once your fakémon is created, you will be able to edit their stats, images, and details!
fakemon.descriptionPlaceholder: The ______ Pokémon. It is known for this one rather cool thing.
fakemon.convertTutorialText: Use these fields in order to convert Pokémon game base stats to D&D attributes. The conversion tool is merely an estimate, and no pokémon in the official guide follows this exactly. Tweak your fakémon's stats after using this tool!
fakemon.convertPokeStatsToDnDStats: Convert Poké Stats to D&D Stats
fakemon.portraitTutorialText: A square image with a transparent background works best. If you don't upload shiny variations, you can use the Hue Slider to draft one.
fakemon.spriteTutorialText: A square 96 × 96 image with a transparent background works best for sprites. If you don't upload sprites, then a downsized version of the portrait will be used.
fakemon.hueTutorialText: If you don't upload shiny variations, use this hue slider to make one.
fakemon.evolutionNoteText: You can only customize evolutions between Fakémon you own or official Pokémon.
fakemon.thisFakemonDesNotEvolveIntoAnything: This Fakémon does not evolve into anything.
fakemon.thisFakemonDesNotEvolveFromAnything: This Fakémon does not evolve from anything.

backups.title: Backups
backups.introduction:
All of the data for your trainers and custom pokemon are stored locally on your computer. This is why you don't need an account to use the Poké 5e app! Unfortunately, it also means you can lose your data if your browser's data gets cleared.

To protect against this, it's a good idea to back up your list of trainers and fakémon so that you can recover them, just in case.
backups.downloadDescription: This will download a .poke5e file containing the IDs and Access Keys of all your Trainers and Fakémon.
backups.restoreDescription: Choose a .poke5e file on your device. This adds the Trainers and Fakémon in the file to this site.
backups.restoreSuccessful: Backup successfully restored! Found {trainers} trainers and {fakemon} fakémon.
backups.restoreError: Something went wrong restoring the backup. {message}
backups.manualDescription: If you wish to manually keep your trainer IDs and Fakémon somewhere, you may copy them from below.
backups.manualDisclaimer: Note: The manual backup cannot be uploaded to automatically restore missing trainers and fakémon.
